page.description: Defines a conditional section that evaluates if a javascript expression is true/false.

section.description: Templates can include conditional sections. Conditionals allow you to choose what to do when specific values, aka conditions, are met. The {*if logicalExpression} command that helps define a conditional section in a template. 'logicalExpression'' is any Javascript expression that evaluates to a true/false value.
For example, consider the following data:
When an employee's state is "MA" we would like to print the text "Employee is based in MA".
This will result in the following
section.example:
Employee name:Fred Smith Employee is based in MA
Employee name:Laura Linneker
Employee name:Junior Programmer Employee is based in MA
Employee name:Bill Lindsey
